text.value:
The original mural is lost and opinions differ as to where in the Palace of Whitehall it was. But it must have made a startling impact: we have a surviving ‘cartoon’ – a 1:1 scale working drawing used by the artist and his assistants for the painting of a mural, and the scale (270 X 360 cm) made it remarkable. Size mattered to Henry as did the naturalistic style of a court painter imported from Augsburg/ Basel to bring a fresh sophistication to his court.

In this exercise we follow the stages of fresco painting. Put the different stages in order, first at the top, last at the bottom. (If you have never studied painting techniques, you should still be able to work out the stages by which we believe Holbein worked.)
